page.title: 05EMPLOYMENT IN KN0TTINGLEY
page.content: Most of the work force is in industry but there is a gradual move over to the service industries,such as hairdessing,hotel and leisure work. There are 1600 unemployed people who live in Knottingley and Pontefract. Two hundred of these people go to the Job Centre each week and 45 to 55 of these people all find work.One hundred of the people unemployed are school leavers. At the Job Centre in Knottingley there are two people working.The Job Centre opens at 9am and closes at 5pm . The calmest time of the year is February and they have got at least 400 jobs on the cards in February .The age of people looking for work falls mainly in the 35 to 60 year old group .Mornings are the busiest time.
